Sure, here's a use case scenario for the Learning and Development Manager persona:
```diff
<Persona> Learning and Development Manager
<Challenge> We want to improve the effectiveness of our training programs.
<Challenge> We want to increase the adoption of our training programs.
<Challenge> We want to improve the retention of the knowledge acquired through training programs.

<Example Learning Data>
- Number of training programs completed by employees
- Percentage of employees passing post-training assessments
- Average scores on feedback surveys for training programs
- Number of employees participating in follow-up training sessions
- Percentage of employees applying the knowledge acquired in training programs
- Average scores on performance evaluations of employees who have completed training programs
```
As you can see, this scenario provides different types of challenges and different types of learning data that can be correlated with those challenges. Providing this scenario to your sellers will help them to understand how to correlate the efficacy of the training with both external and internal data.
